provisions.title: Section 3
provisions.content:
3 . - ( I ) An application to register a geographical indication, shall be t:,@$Zm.
made to the Registrar in the form set out as Fonn 1 in the First Schedule.   F m I.
                                                                                   firm
          (2) An application referred to in paragraph (1) shall-                   Schedule.
         (a) be in the English Language;
         (b) where any documents submitted in support of the application are in
             a language other than English, be accompanied by an English
             translation of each such document certified by the translator's
             knowledge, a complete and accurate translation;
         (c) contain the information specified in paragraph 3; and
                                                                                   S&cnd
         (4 be accompanied by the appropriate fee under the Second Schedule. Schedu'e.
           (3) An application shall contain the following information (1)
shall-
         (a) where the applicant is-
                 (i) an individual, the full name and address of the applicant
                     and information as to his nationality;
                (ii) a person other than an individual, its official designation
                     and principal place of business or registered address;
                             THE PROTECTION O F GEOGRAPHICAL INDICATIONS REGULATION
                                  (ii) a person other than an individual, its official d{signation
                                       and principal place of business or registered address;
                                 (iii) a corporation, the country in which it is incorporated;
                                                                                                   I
                                 (iv) a body not falling within sub-paragraph (ii) or, (iii), the
                                      country in which it is domiciled;
                           (b) the geographical area to which the geographical indication relates,
                                including the map of the territory of the country, or the iegion or
                                locality in that territory, in which the goods originate or ire being
                                                                                            !
                                manufactured;
                           (c) the quality, reputation or other characteristics of the goods in
                                relation to which the geographical indication is used, including
                                information-                                                 I
                                  (i)     as to how the geographical indication serves to designate
                                         the goods as originating from the particular territory of the
                                         country, or region or locality in the territory; and
                                  (ii) in respect of the quality, reputation or other characteristics
                                        of the goods, which are attributable essentially,to their
                                        geographical origin, including any inherent natural and
                                        human factors, as produced, processed or prepared in such
                                        territory, region or locality.
                             (4) An application submitted pursuant to this regulation, 'shall be
                     signed by the applicant or the applicant's duly authorized agent. L
                                                                                                       I

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5 . 4 1 ) Subject to paragraph (2);an applicant may at any time before
    tian af appli-   registration of the relevant geographical indication, submit to the Re'gistrar a
1   cation.
    F m 2.           request, in the form set out as Form 2 in the First Schedule,' for the
    Firn
    Schedule.        amendment of or correction of any error appearing in, or in connectibn with,
                     the application.                                                       !
                              (2) An amendment or correction, the effect of which would
                     substantially alter the application submitted pursuant to sub-paragraph (I),
                     shall not be made in relation to the-                               I
                           (a) description of the goods; or                                                I
                                                                                                           I
                           (b) geographical location to which the application relates.                     I
                             (3) Where the Registrar decides to grant or refvse a nqueit made
                     pursuant to this regulation, the Registrar shall notify the applican) of the
                     decision and the reasons therefor within fourteen days after making the
                     decision.

provisions.title: Section 6
provisions.content:
6.-41) Where the Registrar examines an application, and finds that it Examinaion
                                                                                  o f application by
does not satisfy the conditions specified in section 10 (2) of the Act, he shall, Registrar.
by notice in writing-
       (a) inform the applicant of the finding and the reasons therefor; and'
       (b) invite the applicant to-
               (i) make the necessary amendments or modifications;
               (ii) submit written representations in response to the findings;
                    or
              (iii) apply for a hearing.
        (2) Where the applicant requests a hearing, the Registrar shall give
the applicant no less than one month's notice in writing of the date of the
hearing.
         (3) Where the applicant-
       (a) does not, within two months of being notified pursuant to para-
           graph ( I ) , comply with the action required under the notice; or
       (6) fails to attend a hearing after being notified in accordance with
           paragraph (3), the application shall be deemed by the Registrar to
           have been withdrawn.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7.-41) Where the Registrar accepts an application the Registrar shall Publication
                                                                          of application
inform the applicant by notice in writing of the Registrar's-             in the G ~ l l e
                                                                                         or daily murt
       (a) acceptance of the application; and                                            pap.
       (b) intention to publish the application.
         (2) An application published pursuant to paragraph (2) shall state-
       (a) the date of filing of the application;
       (b) the proposed date of registration of the geographical indication;
       (c) the name, address and (as the case may require) the nationality or
           Country of incorporation or domicile, of the applicant, or his agent
           and his address for service;
       (4 the goods to which the geographical indication applies;
       (e) how the geographical indication is to be used and any conditions
           under which the indication may be used;
       u> the quality, reputation or other characteristics of the goods;
       (g) the demarcation of the geographical area to which the geographical
           indication applies; and
       (h) in accordance with regulation 8(1), the time allowed for the
           lodging of objections to the registration.
                  (The inclusion of this page is authorid by L.N. ZIROlZ]
    Objection to           8 . 4 1 ) A person who objects to the registration of a geographical
    registration
:   of geographical   indication (hereinafter referred to as "the objector") may, within three months
    indication.       from the date of publication of the application for registration or within such
                      further time, not exceeding one month, as the Registrar may allow!, give a
    Form 3.           notice of objection to the Registrar in the form set out as Form 3 in the First
    First Schedule                                                                            I
                      Schedule.
                               (2) The notice referred to in    (1) shall set out the 'grounds
                      on which the objector relies, and be accompanied by any supporting
                      evidence.                                                       I
                                 (3) The objector shall serve a copy of the notice referred to ,in para-
                      graph (I) on the'applicant at his address for service pursuant to regulation 7
                      (3)(c).

            These notes will help you to ti11 in this form. ~fyou need any more help or you have any
            questions. please contact the Geographical Indication Registry.                   I
            Write your answers in capital letters using black ink or you may type them.       I
            If there is not enough space for your answer to any section of this form, use separate
            sheets. Number each one and mite on the form how many extra sheets you have used.
            Once you have filled in the form you must remember to sign and date it.             I
            This form is used if you want to defend your application against a third pmty h o has
            lodged an opposition against your application or application to rectify, or to invalidate
            your registration. (Rule 9(1) of the htection of Geographical Indications Reg$ations.
            2009 refers).
            You must send us details df the grounds for this counter statement on a separate sheet of
            Peper.
            If your address for service is difkent from w u r agent,then please give us full d*li of
            both.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. The Registrar shall publish from time to time, in the Gazette or in the          ~istoi
Geographical Indications Journal (referred to in regulation 15), a list of               %z$A?'
the geographical indications registered in accordance with the Act.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-41) An application for rectification under section 12, or a request Application
for cancellation of registration under section 13, of the Act shall be made Em?$:
in the form set out in Form 6 in the First Schedule.                        of rcg~nrntion
                                                                            Form 6
                                                                                         Firn Schedule
       (2) The application or request referred to in paragraph (1) shall be
accompanied by a statement setting out-
      (a) the nature of the person's interest;
      (b) the facts and grounds which form the basis of the case; and
      (c) the relief sought.
          (3) The Registrar shall publish a copy of the application or request
referred to in paragraph (I), by notice in a daily newspaper in circulation
throughout Jamaica, specifying-
      (a) the time within which the parties may submit written submissions
          in respect thereof to the Registrar; and
      (b) the time within which any other interested party may apply to be
          joined in the matter.
         (4) The person making the application or request referred to in
paragraph (I), shall bear the cost of publishing the notice referred to in
paragraph (3).

                    as to whether the registration shall be cancelled or rectified as the case

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15. The Registrar may publish an annual journal which shall be enlitled
                     "The Geographical Indications Journal" and which shall contain-
                                      me inclusion of this page is authorized by L.N.ZlROlZ]                           !
                 THE PROTECTION OF GEOGRAPHICAL INDICATIONS REGULATION
              (a) the particulars of pending applications under the Act for the
                   registration of geographical indications; and
              (b) such other information relating to geographical indications as the
                  Registrar thinks fit.

provisions.title: Section 16
provisions.content:
16.--(1) A request under section 17(2) (6) of the Act for the Registrar to EBy$;nof
        refuse or, as the case may require, revoke, the registration of a trade mark misleading
        misleading as to the origin of a good, shall be made in the form set out as 22:".
        Form 8 in the First Schedule.                                                  Fim S C ~ ~ ~ U I C .
    a           (2) A request under section 18 of the Act, for the Registrar to refuse
        or revoke the registration of a trade mark that inaccurately identifies the
        origin of wines or spirits, shall be made in the form set out as Form 9 in the       ,,, ,.
        First Schedule.
                 (3) For the purposes of section 17(3) and 18 of the Act, the time
        within the Registrar shall notify the proprietor of a trade mark of the decision
        to refuse registration is twenty-one days after making the decision.
                (4) Where the Registrar revokes a trade mark under section 18 of
        the Act, he shall cause a copy to be published in the Gazette and a
        daily newspaper in circulation throughout Jamaica, a notice of the
        revocation.
                ( 5 ) A notice of revocation published pursuant to section 17(3) of the
        Act or paragraph (4) of this regulation, shall include--
I             (a) the representation of the trade mark;
              (6) the particulars of the registration of the trade mark including the
                  date of registration;
I
              (c) the name and address of the registered proprietor;
              (d) the list of goods and services in respect of which the trade mark
                  was registered with an indication of the corresponding class or
                  classes of the Nice Classification; and
              (e) the grounds on which the registration of the trade mark is invalid.
                (6) In this Regulation, "Nice Classification" means the International
        Classification of Goods and Services, for the purposes of the Registration of
I       Marks determined pursuant to the Nice Agreement made in Nice, France
        on the 15th day of June, 1957.

provisions.title: Section 17
provisions.content:
17. The fees specified in the section column of the Second Schedule shall F"s.
        be payable in respect of the services set out in relation thereto in the first sMnd
        column of that Schedule.                                                       Schedule.
